channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Carvana Survived Its Stock Crashing—Twice—by Following This 1 Simple Rule
item.description: Carvana reimagined the car-buying process all while enduring a ‘roller coaster.’ CEO Ernie Garcia said he’s learned something clutch along the way.

item.title: PayPal and UPS are sparking a late-session rally, powering stocks to fresh records
item.description: S&P added 0.4%, Dow Jones was up 0.6%, and the Nasdaq was 1% higher.

item.title: This Startup Raised $100M to Take on One of Tech’s White Whales: American-Made Computer Chips
item.description: Founder Fund-backed Substrate has emerged as a potential competitor to semiconductor giant ASML.

item.title: From retail to tech, here are the 10 corporations that recently announced mass layoffs
item.description: Companies are pointing to factors like tariff costs, shifts in consumer spending, and investments in AI that have led them to let go of thousands.

item.title: A federal judge just indefinitely barred the Trump administration from firing federal employees during the government shutdown
item.description: The judge previously issued a temporary restraining order against the job cuts that was set to expire on Wednesday.

item.title: As OpenAI restructures, Microsoft locks in long-term gains
item.description: OpenAI has become a public benefit corporation, giving Microsoft a 27% stake and long-term access to research methods

item.title: Wild Corporate Espionage Claims Are Rocking the World of 401(k) Administration
item.description: Human Interest has alleged that two former sales reps were involved in funelling intelligence to competitor Guideline.

item.title: This Candy Company Filed For Bankruptcy Days Before Halloween
item.description: Rising candy costs may be the spookiest part of the holiday.
